version.description: The version of the schema, adhering to semantic versioning.

phase.description: Defines the current phase of the storytelling or world-building process.

genre.description: Genre of the story or world.

setting.description: The setting or environment of the world.

themes.description: Core themes that will drive the narrative elements of the world.

world-building-elements.description: Key elements that contribute to the structure of the world.

plot-devices.description: Plot devices used to advance the story or enrich the narrative.

conflicts.description: Major conflicts that drive the narrative within the world.

narrative-hooks.description: Narrative hooks that grab the attention of the audience.

emotional-tone.description: The overall emotional tone of the world or story.

content-rating.description: Content rating to categorize the suitability of the world or story for different audiences.

themes.description: Central themes of the world explained through examples.

genre-integration.description: How the genre is integrated into the world's elements.

emotional-tone-reflections.description: Reflections of the emotional tone through various world aspects.

initial-conflicts.description: Initial conflicts introduced in the world.

narrative-hook-integration.description: Integration of narrative hooks into the storyline.

content-rating-considerations.description: Considerations for content rating based on world elements.

unique-world-elements.description: Unique elements that define the world.

geographic-overview.description: A broad description of the world's geography.

climate-zones.description: Different climate zones within the world and their effects on the region.

flora.description: The types of plant life in the world and their characteristics.

fauna.description: Animal life and their behaviors within their specific habitats.

natural-resources.description: Important natural resources, their locations, and significance.

environmental-challenges.description: Environmental challenges and their effects on different regions.

sights.description: Visual elements that are characteristic of the world.

sounds.description: Distinctive sounds that define the auditory landscape of the world.

scents.description: Characteristic scents associated with various locations in the world.

taste.description: Common tastes associated with the world, such as typical flavors found in its cuisine.

touch.description: Textural elements characteristic of the world's environment.

eras.description: Major historical eras of the world and their defining characteristics.

pivotal-events.description: Significant events that have shaped the history and trajectory of the world.

cultural-evolution.description: An overview of how the culture(s) within the world have evolved over time.

technological-magical-progression.description: Progression of technology and magic in the world, highlighting key developments.

major-conflicts.description: Major conflicts and their effects on the world's history and development.

historical-figures.description: Influential figures in the world's history and their legacies.

mysteries-debates.description: Key mysteries and debates that are central to the historical narrative of the world.

government-systems.description: The types of governmental systems in place within the world and their main features.

social-hierarchy.description: Description of the social hierarchy and class structure within the world.

economic-system.description: Overview of the economic systems governing the world's societies.

legal-system.description: Outline of the legal frameworks and their implications for the inhabitants.

power-centers.description: Key power centers within the world and their influence on politics and society.

marginalized-groups.description: Groups within the society that are marginalized or face specific challenges.

education-system.description: Details of the educational systems and their roles in societal development.

cultural-institutions.description: Prominent cultural institutions and their influence on the society.

belief-systems.description: Major belief systems within the world and their influences on culture and society.

customs-traditions.description: Customs and traditions that are significant within the world.

arts-entertainment.description: Forms of arts and entertainment and their roles in the society.

social-norms.description: Social norms and the mechanisms by which they are enforced.

system-overview.description: Overview of the technological and magical systems in the world.

key-elements.description: Key elements of the technology and magic systems, including their capabilities and limitations.

rules-limitations.description: Rules and limitations governing the use of technology and magic.

distribution-access.description: How technology and magic are distributed and accessed within the world.

physical-world-interactions.description: Interactions between the technological/magical systems and the physical world.

global-tensions.description: Global tensions and their implications for world stability and politics.

resource-conflicts.description: Conflicts over resources, parties involved, and their broader impacts.

ideological-struggles.description: Major ideological struggles within the world and how they manifest.

technological-magical-dilemmas.description: Dilemmas arising from the use of technology and magic, including potential solutions.

social-unrest.description: Sources of social unrest, affected groups, and possible escalations.

emerging-threats.description: Emerging threats to the world, public perceptions, and potential impacts.

major-languages.description: Major languages spoken in the world and their characteristics.

language-families.description: Overview of the language families within the world.

writing-systems.description: Writing systems used within the world and their user demographics.

non-verbal-communication.description: Non-verbal communication methods and their significance within different cultures of the world.

language-and-power.description: The role of language in power dynamics within the world.

unique-linguistic-features.description: Unique linguistic features that define or distinguish specific languages or dialects.

key-interconnections.description: Key interconnections between different elements of the world and their consequences.

emergent-themes.description: Emerging themes that are becoming significant in the world's evolving narrative.

character-archetypes.description: Character archetypes common in the world and the conflicts they typically encounter.

story-seeds.description: Narrative ideas or seeds that could potentially develop into larger storylines.

world-mysteries.description: Mysteries within the world that hold significant narrative potential.

future-developments.description: Potential future developments and the catalysts that might trigger them.

identified-inconsistencies.description: Inconsistencies identified within the world and their resolutions.

refined-elements.description: Elements of the world that have been refined, along with the reasons for these changes.

identified-gaps.description: Gaps identified in the world-building process, their importance, and suggested ways to address them.

world-cohesion-assessment.description: An assessment of how cohesively the various elements of the world fit together.

world-bible.description: A comprehensive document detailing all aspects of the world for reference.

changed-element.description: The element of the world that was changed.

phase.description: The phase during which the change occurred.

original-value.description: The original value of the changed element before modification.

new-value.description: The new value of the changed element after modification.

change-history.description: History of changes made to the world-building elements.
